title: Contributing
text:
We are seeking contributors to this manual. Please contact @vlzimmer for



We develop the content using RStudio, build the book using Quarto (via RStudio), and collaborate and publish using GitHub (also via RStudio).


To contribute, you must do the following, and it should only take about 20 minutes to complete:

Install R and RStudio
Both R and RStudio should be available in the Software Center (for Windows 10) or Company Portal (for Windows 11) – if you don’t see them in your Software Center/Company Portal or you have issues/questions during the instillation process, please send a request to the DIT HelpDesk and they can help you install them.
Also see these step by step instructions on how to install these programs – you will only need to go through steps 1 and 2
If you are new to R, it would also be helpful if you could review the Getting Started Module so you can begin to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals of the program.
Install Quarto
Quarto download and install instructions
Create a GitHub Account
Create your free personal account GitHub account
Tips on choosing your username
Download and Install Git
Follow your operating system’s normal Git installation process. Note: you will not see an application called Git listed but if the installation process completed it was likely successful, and we will confirm together.

title: Travel
text:
Exempt, excluded, and represented state employees may be eligible for the reimbursement of authorized out-of-pocket expenses that are reasonably, actually, and necessarily incurred as a result of conducting state business.


The Division has several vehicles available for field work. Please see DWR Employee Resources Fleet Page for up-to-date information about using fleet vehicles.




Travel Pocket Guide (Intranet) - can only access on VPN 
CalTravelStore / Concur (where you book your travel)
CalATERS Global (where you submit your travel expense claims [TEC] for reimbursement)
CalHR Manual - Allowances and Travel Reimbursements Section
CalHR Webpage - Travel Reimbursements 
Water Board’s Travel Page (Intanet) - can only access on VPN 
Travel Forms (Intranet) - can only access on VPN 




CalTravelStore New User Registration
For new users to be added to CalTravelStore to begin making reservations, contact the CalATERS Travel Help Desk.
Email: CalATERS-Travel@waterboards.ca.gov
Phone: (916) 341-5036
The CalATERS Travel Help Desk can provide assistance or answer questions about making travel reservations, recommendations while traveling, and asking for reimbursement when you return. The Travel Help Desk for the Waterboards is comprised of the Travel Unit staff in the Accounting Office as part of the Division of Administrative Services. 
Visit CalTravelStore, a self-serve site for all government business travel needs. Travelers are able to make reservations for lodging, airfare, rental car & rail fare through Concur which is personalized to meet the needs of State government travelers.



Get approval to travel; if traveling for training or a conference - see the Training section for forms that must be completed and approved before booking travel arrangements
Book your travel (flights, hotels, rental cars) using the CalTravelStore / Concur system.
Travel to and from your destination and save all receipts (see Tip #2 below for details)
Submit your Travel Expense Claim for reimbursement - this is currently a 3-step process:

Gather your receipts and complete your TEC in CalATERS Global - save a PDF of the TEC for use in Step 2 below
Complete the Adobe Sign process to get you TEC digitally signed and approved
Once you received a digitally signed version of your TEC, submit that and all of your required original receipts to Accounting. This can be done by dropping of your TEC package in-person in the CalEPA building, or mailing it in using the address provided on page 1 of your TEC.






Ask your Supervisor for a copy of the Adobe Sign Instruction guide - this will walk you through the 3-step TEC process above in more detail.
Receipts should be submitted for every item of expense of $25 or more. When receipts are not required to be submitted with a travel expense claim, it is the employee’s responsibility to maintain receipts and records of their actual expenses. Read more information on reimbursement here.  
Know your reimbursement rates! State employees may be eligible to receive reimbursement for expenses such as:

Method of travel (transportation)
Meals and incidentals
Short-term lodging
Out-of-state travel
Out-of-country travel
Personal vehicle mileage 
Other actual and necessary business and/or travel costs incurred while conducting official state business

Airline reservations should be made no more than 30 days prior to the expected travel dates.

Department of General Services (DGS) recommends booking flights between 21 to 30 days prior to travel.
Frequent travelers should book non-refundable fares since there is a high probability that the unused funds will be used for future travel within the expiration period.
Non-frequent travelers should book non-refundable fares if the trips dates are fixed and there is a low probability of a change in plans.






CalATERS Travel Help Desk
Phone: (916) 341-5036
Email: CalATERS-Travel@waterboards.ca.gov

title: Procurement
text:
Procurement
Please work with DWRs’s procurement lead to coordinate your supplies purchases. The process changes frequently. It can take several months (up to 12 months or more) from time of placing order to receiving goods, so plan in advance if possible.

title: Inspiration
text:
Inspiration
The impetus for developing this manual began in 2024 when some of us participated in the Water Boards Openscapes Champions Cohort.
This Manual was started with help from the folks behind the, SWAMP Manual, who generously shared their time and code to get us started!
We are also inspired by the following sources:

Openscapes and their Approach Guide
NOAA Fisheries (NMFS) Open Science Resource Book
The Fay Lab Manual

title: Stream Gaging Team
text:
Stream gaging and bathymetry measurements are currently being done by a variety of units for different projects, mostly within the Division of Water Rights. Division equipment is internally on Sharepoint.








Name
Project(s)
Expertise




Val Zimmer
Clear Lake Hitch
Flow measurement, Rating curve development, equipment, data management

title: Welcome!
text:
Welcome!
This manual is under construction.
This is an online reference and resource written by and for the Division of Water Rights at the California State Water Resources Control Board (State Water Board).
This manual is written to help train staff in stream gaging, instream flow measurement, and bathymetry measurement. Topics may include equipment, preparation for field work, data collection, data processing, and data storage. It is a place to document institutional knowledge and provide references to available resources.
This Quarto book is an open, living, and continuously iterating resource. If you have suggestions for additions or revisions you think should be incorporated into this book, please follow the guidance provided in the Contributing chapter.
